intro: Asphodelus lusitanicus, commonly known as the Iberian asphodel, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and tall, slender stems. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Asphodelus lusitanicus is often found in Mediterranean climates and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
